I had to do a few things in the Twin Cities, so I thought I'd check in with ya about that USIF search on Shep Proudfoot... Oh, yah?...  Well, maybe I'll go visit with him if I have the...  No, I can find that...  Well, thanks a bunch.  Say, d'ya happen to know a good place for lunch in the downtown area?...  Yah, the Radisson...  Oh, yah?  Is it reasonable?

[131]Yah. 
[132]Yah.

dialogues.CARL:
[1]No, that's not it, Jerry. 
[2]The new vehicle, plus forty thousand dollars. 
[3]Shep didn't tell us much, Jerry. 
[4]Except that you were gonna be here at 7:30. 
[5]Yeah, you already said that. 
[6]I'm not gonna debate you, Jerry. 
[7]I'm not gonna sit here and debate. I will say this though:  what Shep told us didn't make a whole lot of sense. 
[8]You want your own wife kidnapped? 
[9]...  You - my point is, you pay the ransom - what eighty thousand bucks? -  I mean, you give us half the ransom, forty thousand, you keep half.  It's like robbing Peter to play Paul, it doesn't make any - 
[10]What kind of trouble are you in, Jerry? 
[11]So why don't you just ask him for the money? 
[12]Or your fucking wife, Jerry. 
[13]Personal matters. 
[14]Okay, Jerry.  You're tasking us to perform this mission, but you, you won't, uh, you won't - aw, fuck it, let's take a look at that Ciera. 
[15]What? 
[16]What're you, nuts?  We had pancakes for breakfast.  I gotta go somewhere I can get a shot and a beer - and a steak maybe. Not more fuckin' pancakes.  Come on. 
[17]...  Come on, man.  Okay, here's an idea.  We'll stop outside of Brainerd.  I know a place there we can get laid.  Wuddya think? 
[18]Yeah, yeah, Jesus - I'm sayin', we'll stop for pancakes, then we'll get laid.  Wuddya think? 
[19]Oh, Jesus, yeah. 
[20]...  Look at that.  Twin Cities. IDS Building, the big glass one. Tallest skyscraper in the Midwest. After the Sears, uh, Chicago... You never been to Minneapolis? 
[21]...  Would it kill you to say something? 
[22]"No." First thing you've said in the last four hours.  That's a, that's a fountain of conversation, man.  That's a geyser.  I mean, whoa, daddy, stand back, man.  Shit, I'm sittin' here driving, man, doin' all the driving, whole fuckin' way from Brainerd, drivin', tryin' to, you know, tryin' to chat, keep our spirits up, fight the boredom of the road, and you can't say one fucking thing just in the way of conversation. 
[23]...  Well, fuck it, I don't have to talk either, man.  See how you like it...

[7]No.  Like I say, he was funny-looking. More'n most people even. 
[8]They said they were goin' to the Twin Cities? 
[9]Yah.  Is that useful to ya?
dialogues.YOUNGER MAN:
[1]You're Jerry Lundegaard? 
[2]Shep said you'd be here at 7:30. What gives, man? 
[3]We been sitting here an hour. I've peed three times already. 
[4]Ya got the car? 
[5]Yeah, okay.  Well, siddown then. I'm Carl Showalter and this is my associate Gaear Grimsrud. 
[6]Sure, Jerry, we're all set.  Why wouldn't we be?
dialogues.WIFE:
[1]Yah, I think so...  Dad, are you stayin' for supper? 
[2]Where are you going? 
[3]He sees his friends there.  It's okay. 
[4]It's okay, Dad. 
[5]Please, dear. 
[6]Bucky, please!
dialogues.TROOPER:
[1]This is a new car, then, sir? 
[2]You're required to display temporary tags, either in the plate area or taped inside the back window. 
[3]Can I see your license and registration please? 
[4]What's this, sir? 
[5]Put that back in your pocket, please. 
[6]...  And step out of the car, please, sir.
dialogues.HOOKER TWO:
[1]LeSeure.  But I went to high school in White Bear Lake. 
[2]He was a little older.  Looked like the Marlboro man. 
[3]Yah.  Maybe I'm sayin' that cause he smoked Marlboros. 
[4]A subconscious-type thing. 
[5]Yah. 
[6]Yah.
dialogues.COP ONE:
[1]Mr. Anderson... 
[2]Mr. Anderson, is this your burgundy 88 out here? 
[3]Could you open the door, please? 
[4]Dale! 
[5]Call an ambulance! 
[6]Yah, yah, call an ambulance.
